context: However, from <a0_0><b5_0>1971 to 1975<b5_0/><a0_0/>, NBA teams played preseason exhibitions against American Basketball Association teams. In the early days of the NBA, league clubs sometimes challenged the legendary barnstorming <a1_0><b6_0>Harlem Globetrotters<b6_0/><a1_0/>, with mixed success. The NBA has played preseason games in <a2_0><b7_0>Europe and Asia<b7_0/><a2_0/>. In the <b9_0>2006 and 2007 seasons<b9_0/>, the NBA and the primary European club competition, <a4_0>the Euroleague<a4_0/>, conducted a preseason tournament featuring two NBA teams and the finalists from that year's Euroleague.[citation needed] In the <b8_0>1998-99 and 2011-12<b8_0/> seasons, teams were limited to only <a3_0>two<a3_0/> preseason games due to lockouts.
